name: Acute Mesenteric Ischemia
chief_complaint: Severe abdominal pain that came on suddenly
prognosis: Poor if not treated promptly; mortality rate remains high even with treatment
description: Acute mesenteric ischemia is a life-threatening vascular emergency that occurs when blood flow to the intestines is suddenly blocked, typically by a blood clot. This leads to intestinal tissue hypoxia and potential necrosis if not treated urgently.
